alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 10:32AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Calhoun, Gulf and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Ocheessee Landing in Calhoun County is flooded, restricting access to the boat ramp and parking area. Kennedy Creek at Forest Road 115 in Liberty County floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday /10:15 AM EDT Sunday/ the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Sunday /10:15 AM EDT Sunday/ was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 02/16/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
